error.signature: interface conversion: interface is nil, not T

verdict.summary: Type assertion on a nil interface value.

dead_ends.action: Using recover() globally to catch the panic
dead_ends.why_fails: Masks the nil interface bug; inconsistent state continues

dead_ends.action: Checking for nil after the assertion
dead_ends.why_fails: Panic already happened; nil check is too late

workarounds.action: Use the two-value type assertion: val, ok := iface.(T); if !ok { handle }
workarounds.how: Safe form doesn't panic; ok is false if assertion fails

workarounds.action: Check for nil before type-asserting: if iface != nil { val := iface.(T) }
workarounds.how: Nil interfaces always fail type assertions
